about:
Jack of all trades and master of ONE - that's how I would define myself! I am a Computer Science graduate student and an NLP researcher at Texas A&M University under Dr. Ruihong Huang. My interests mainly lie in applications of LLMs in production systems and black-box LLM Interpretability. I bring 2+ years of industry experience in building Machine Learning pipelines from my work as a Data Engineer at Wells Fargo. My technical proficiency spans several object-oriented programming languages, including Java, C++, Python, and Groovy, along with ML frameworks like Apache Kafka, Git, Jenkins, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.

Having graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT BHU), one of India's top 10 engineering schools, I possess both the academic foundation and the practical experience to excel at any work that comes my way. I have received accolades from my previous employers for being a quick learner and a responsible employee who takes full ownership of his work.

While I am focused on mastering my knowledge about LLMs, but why Jack of all trades? I love exploring new areas and playing around with things I donâ€™t know yet. My experience in mobile app development, entrepreneurship and game development as hobby projects, make me an all-round player. Opportunities to build innovative and valuable products have never failed to excite me.

publications.title: Evaluating Gender Bias of LLMs in Making Morality Judgements
publications.authors: Divij Bajaj, Yuanyuan Lei, Jonathan Tong, Ruihong Huang
description: Curated a novel dataset containing parallel short stories with a male and female protagonist performing moral/immoral actions.
Evaluated current closed and open-source Large Language Models (LLMs) to identify the presence of gender bias in making morality judgments using the curated dataset.

publications.title: Wisdom of (Binned) Crowds: A Bayesian Stratification Paradigm for Crowd Counting
publications.authors: Shivapuja, S. V., Khamkar, M. P., Bajaj, D., Ramakrishnan, G., & Sarvadevabhatla, R. K.
description: Developed a novel smoothed Bayesian sample stratification approach in PyTorch to enable balanced mini-batch sampling in large, heavy-tailed Computer Vision datasets, achieving a 25% reduction in standard deviation.
Executed a novel data augmentation approach to reduce skewness in existing datasets by over 40%.

projects.title: Mitigating Gender Bias in GPT-2 by identifying Biased Training Samples
description: Leveraging Influence Functions to identify most influential training samples given a concept such as Gender Bias
Employing techniques such as Machine Unlearning to learn an unbiased GPT-2
Evaluating on Gender Bias datasets such as Winobias among others.

projects.title: Context-Aware Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) using Reinforcement Learning
description: Designed an approach to retrieve the sentences relevant to a target sentence from long documents that do not fit in the limited input size of current LLMs.
Evaluated the method on various downstream NLP tasks like information retrieval and question answering.
